title: 2022 Vegetable School - Intro to High Tunnel Vegetable Production

tasks.task: Discuss the challenges and benefits of high-tunnel vegetable production, including extending growing seasons, mitigating weather risks, and increasing crop yields.
subtasks: Explain the structure and components of high-tunnels, such as lumber or aluminum frames, single-layer 6 mil film, and ventilation mechanisms.
Highlight the ability of high-tunnels to extend growing seasons by allowing early spring and late fall planting, as well as frost protection and reduced pest pressure.
Discuss the importance of proper planting dates, crop rotation, and succession for high-tunnel efficiency.
Emphasize the role of high-tunnels in mitigating weather-related risks such as frost, wind damage, and heavy rainfall.
Address the need for integrated pest management, including exclusion systems, irrigation scheduling, and disease prevention.
Highlight the benefits of high-value crops in high-tunnel production and the importance of creating a year-round cropping plan.
Mention the significance of organic certification and marketing strategies, such as off-season windows and value-added products.

tasks.task: Explain the importance of proper fertilization and irrigation management in high-tunnel vegetable production.
subtasks: Describe the necessary fertilization practices, including compost and manure application, timing, and liquid fertilization.
Advocate for the use of drip irrigation systems over sprinkler systems in high-tunnels due to disease risk and water efficiency.
Recommend soil moisture sensors for irrigation scheduling and systematic irrigation panel use.

tasks.task: Discuss the implementation of crop rotation and succession planning for high-tunnel vegetable production.
subtasks: Outline a sample four-step crop rotation plan for high-tunnel vegetables, considering common diseases and pests.
Stress the importance of diversifying crops to minimize disease and pest buildup.

tasks.task: Introduce the concept of pest management in high-tunnel environments.
subtasks: Explain the benefits of permanent exclusion systems for insect control.
Emphasize the need for regular scouting and preventive management strategies for diseases, insects, and weeds.
Provide resources for identifying and managing specific pests in high-tunnel environments.

tasks.task: Summarize the economic benefits of high-tunnel production, such as increased yields, higher market prices, and diversified crop options.
